Title: Mapping Our Funding Narrative
Overall Purpose: To craft a coherent and compelling funding narrative that aligns with our mission and attracts sustainable financial support.
Why This Matters: Without a clear funding narrative, organizations struggle to communicate their value, leading to missed opportunities for support and growth. A well-defined narrative ensures alignment with funders and stakeholders.
When To Use This Protocol: Use when developing fundraising strategies, during budget planning, or when seeking new funding sources.

Overall Outcomes.Poor: You present a disjointed funding story → The future faces inconsistent support and financial instability.
Overall Outcomes.Expected: You articulate a basic funding narrative but lack depth → The future experiences sporadic engagement and moderate growth.
Overall Outcomes.Excellent: You convey a clear and resonant funding narrative → The future enjoys steady support and strategic partnerships.
Overall Outcomes.Transcendent: Your funding narrative becomes a beacon for aligned funders → The future thrives with abundant resources and shared vision.

Themes.Name: Understanding Our Core Message
Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To distill the essence of our mission into a clear and compelling message.
Themes.Why This Matters: A strong core message attracts funders who resonate with our mission and values.

Poor.Present pattern: You lack a unified core message.
Poor.Example moves: Presenting different messages to different audiences.
Poor.Future effect: The future faces inconsistent support and financial instability.

Expected.Present pattern: You have a basic core message.
Expected.Signals: Some funders show interest, others remain indifferent.
Expected.Example moves: Using a standard pitch for all funders.
Expected.Future effect: The future experiences sporadic engagement and moderate growth.

Excellent.Present pattern: You articulate a clear and compelling core message.
Excellent.Example moves: Crafting tailored messages for different funder segments.
Excellent.Future effect: The future enjoys steady support and strategic partnerships.

Transcendent.Present pattern: Your core message resonates deeply with funders.
Transcendent.Edge condition: Avoiding over-reliance on a single message.
Transcendent.Example moves: Engaging funders in co-creating the narrative.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future thrives with abundant resources and shared vision.

Guiding Questions: What is the essence of our mission?
How does our message align with funder values?

Themes.Name: Aligning with Funder Priorities
Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To ensure our funding narrative aligns with the interests and values of potential funders.
Themes.Why This Matters: Alignment with funder priorities increases the likelihood of securing support and building lasting relationships.

Poor.Edge condition: Mistaking our needs for their priorities.
Poor.Example moves: Submitting generic proposals without funder research.
Poor.Future effect: The future faces inconsistent support and financial instability.

Expected.Present pattern: You consider funder priorities to some extent.
Expected.Example moves: Adapting proposals slightly for funder interests.
Expected.Future effect: The future experiences sporadic engagement and moderate growth.

Excellent.Present pattern: You align our narrative with funder priorities effectively.
Excellent.Signals: Positive feedback and increased funding success.
Excellent.Example moves: Customizing proposals to match specific funder goals.
Excellent.Future effect: The future enjoys steady support and strategic partnerships.

Transcendent.Present pattern: Alignment with funder priorities is seamless and natural.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future thrives with abundant resources and shared vision.

Guiding Questions: What are the key priorities of our target funders?
How can we align our narrative with these priorities?
Where do our mission and funder values intersect?

Themes.Name: Crafting a Compelling Story
Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To create a narrative that captivates and inspires potential funders.
Themes.Why This Matters: A compelling story engages funders emotionally, making them more likely to invest in our mission.

Poor.Present pattern: Your story is fragmented and uninspiring.
Poor.Signals: Lack of emotional connection, low engagement.
Poor.Edge condition: Focusing solely on facts and figures.
Poor.Future effect: The future faces inconsistent support and financial instability.

Expected.Present pattern: Your story has some compelling elements.
Expected.Signals: Some funders show interest, others remain unmoved.
Expected.Edge condition: Relying on a few strong points.
Expected.Example moves: Including anecdotes without a cohesive narrative.
Expected.Future effect: The future experiences sporadic engagement and moderate growth.

Excellent.Present pattern: Your story is engaging and well-structured.
Excellent.Example moves: Weaving personal stories with mission impact.
Excellent.Future effect: The future enjoys steady support and strategic partnerships.

Transcendent.Present pattern: Your story inspires and mobilizes funders.
Transcendent.Example moves: Creating multimedia narratives that resonate deeply.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future thrives with abundant resources and shared vision.

Guiding Questions: What elements make our story unique and compelling?
How can we connect emotionally with funders?
What narrative techniques can enhance our story?

Themes.Name: Building Trust and Credibility
Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To establish a reputation of reliability and integrity with funders.
Themes.Why This Matters: Trust and credibility are foundational to securing and maintaining funding relationships.

Poor.Future effect: The future faces inconsistent support and financial instability.

Expected.Immediate cost: Some trust, but room for improvement.
Expected.Example moves: Delivering on promises but with delays.
Expected.Future effect: The future experiences sporadic engagement and moderate growth.

Excellent.Future effect: The future enjoys steady support and strategic partnerships.

Transcendent.Present pattern: Trust and credibility are hallmarks of your organization.
Transcendent.Example moves: Engaging funders in transparent decision-making processes.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future thrives with abundant resources and shared vision.

Guiding Questions: How can we enhance our credibility with funders?
What practices build trust in our funding relationships?
Where might we improve transparency and accountability?

Themes.Name: Engaging Funders as Partners
Themes.Purpose of This Theme: To cultivate collaborative relationships with funders that go beyond transactions.
Themes.Why This Matters: Engaging funders as partners fosters deeper commitment and shared success.

Poor.Present pattern: You treat funders as mere sources of money.
Poor.Signals: Funders feel undervalued, lack of collaboration.
Poor.Example moves: Only contacting funders during fundraising campaigns.
Poor.Future effect: The future faces inconsistent support and financial instability.

Expected.Immediate cost: Some funder involvement, but limited depth.
Expected.Future effect: The future experiences sporadic engagement and moderate growth.

Excellent.Present pattern: You actively involve funders as partners.
Excellent.Edge condition: Balancing funder input with organizational autonomy.
Excellent.Future effect: The future enjoys steady support and strategic partnerships.

Transcendent.Present pattern: Funders are integral partners in your mission.
Transcendent.Signals: Funders champion and expand your mission.
Transcendent.Future effect: The future thrives with abundant resources and shared vision.

Guiding Questions: How can we engage funders as true partners?
What opportunities exist for co-creation with funders?
How do we balance funder input with our mission?

Completion Prompts: Identify one aspect of your funding narrative to refine this month.
Choose a funder to engage more deeply as a partner.
Reflect on a recent funding proposal: Did it align with funder priorities?
